moves.6... Ne4 7. Bd5: Looking for adventure, but this violates the principle of rapid development.
moves.7... Nxf2 8. Kxf2 dxc3+ 9. Kg3: better is king e1, however not Be3, Bxe3 , Kxe3, cxb2.
?!. Sacrificing a queen for a king hunt, this may not work, but it did.
moves.13. Nxd8 Bf2+ 14. Kh3 d6+ 15. e6 Nf4+ 16: Checkmate. Petrov became one of the greatest players in the world.

gameName: Petrov's greatest game of all time
players: F. A. Hoffmann (2600) vs. A.D. Petrov (2500)
